intro: Caulanthus pilosus, commonly known as the hairy bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its distinctive, inflated pods. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are pinnately divided and covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Caulanthus pilosus produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer.
